column5: Favourite among a library of great music...Breakdown (live) where the crowd literally sings the first minute or two of the song and his response: "gonna put me out of a job".  Classic Petty.
Nice tribute on SNL to him as well as the victims who died in in Las Vegas. Jason Aldean, who was onstage during the shooting spree sang won't back down..
Nice tribute, but Aldean has nothing on Tom. Nothing.  S.
Nice tribute, but Aldean has nothing on Tom. Nothing.  S.   Either do you, but sing and play his songs. LOL  Aldean, rocks the country scene.

Im not a great singer or player but i still love to do both.  Im not big on Aldean....or any of the new country stuff really. I like chris stapleton and i do a couple eric church songs, but the rest i call wanna be country.  I dont mind the old country classics, but im more of a rock and roll guy.  S.
Jason Aldean is a singer songwriter, he has everything to do with Tom Petty.
Tom petty is in a whole different league than Aldean. Maybe you missed my point?
One of the best musicians of all time - 2017 has been a terrible year, we've lost some amazing talent so unexpectedly!

That all depends if you are a fan of Aldean and don't know who Tom Petty is because you were born in 1999. Tom Petty is Mom and Dad's music to millennials Sinker. I didn't enjoy listening to Glen Miller, Doris Day and Louis Prima but Mom played their records all day long. Alllllllllllllll dayyyyyyyyyyyy long! Thank the Lord for the British invasion or I would have lost it when I was 9.
Even millenials listen to Tom Petty man!  S.

Tom Petty has sold over 80 million records... probably more since his passing has put his catalogue back up on the Billboard charts. Can't find Aldean's sales, but I would hazard a guess that they are not near the 80 mill + range. HH
Yup, I read an article somewhere the other day saying Tom Petty's sales have increased dramatically since his death.  S.
my 2 sons aged 22 and 17 both listen to and love tom petty along with many other classic rock and this was after toms death.....all college students....they seem to know tom as well
Just saw him. So sad.
Noooo. One of my favs to this day.
Up there with George and Roy , RIP
Travelling wilburys are buried into my brain  Possible the most musical talent ever assembled  RIP

Pretty soon there will be no good ones left. I will jam out all the Tom Petty tunes I know tonight in his honour....the list is long....I may need a couple nights....and probably need new strings on the guitar by the time I get them all done!!! The list is LOOOONG!!
So sad!

Pretty soon there will be no good ones left. I will jam out all the Tom Petty tunes I know tonight in his honour....the list is long....I may need a couple nights....and probably need new strings on the guitar by the time I get them all done!!! The list is LOOOONG!! Giver! Wish I could be there to honor him!

Wow, anyone know the circumstances? Just Saturday we were at the club and this guy came in and he was a Tom Petty clone and we all remarked how uncanny the resemblance. He had a terrible voice that sounded great if that makes any sence.  Sad. condolences to his fans, friends and family.

Wow, anyone know the circumstances? Just Saturday we were at the club and this guy came in and he was a Tom Petty clone and we all remarked how uncanny the resemblance. He had a terrible voice that sounded great if that makes any sence.  Sad. condolences to his fans, friends and family. Massive heart attack. He had no brain activity and they pulled the plug!
http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/tom-petty-rock-iconoclast-who-led-the-heartbreakers-dead-at-66-w506651
Heard this driving home. Sad.  I remember his early stuff, and the TW group was great.
The Waiting...one of my alltime favorite songs
strange thing is I just got in from driving and they would not confirm he had died, just that he was in hospital. There seems to be some confusion.
A rush to be first, work out the details later.
He hasn't passed away yet. His daughter released a statement

huge loss i am a long time fan.His double live lp still gets plenty airtime here or in my truck.Him and  Stevie Nicks were great together . Seen him twice ,great shows and a friend and I were out fishing on erie last week and "refugee' came on the radio and we both said we should go see him again .    rip tom
It's official now, he has passed on
one of the best...the real deal.
A lot of talent. RIP. Loved the Travelling Wilburys back in the day, even now.
We've lost a great musician, and a humble person...
legend
the music talent we have lost is amazing another worth watching legends
one more a real classic,as mentioned I was a huge fan for about 37 years
R.I.P. Tom Petty.
